body_html:
@alykhantejani That should be fine because there aren't many implementations that have long long be more than 64 bits. AFAIK this is true for all of the platforms that pytorch supports.

Besides the bigger change is going from long to int64_t as this changes a 32 bit integer type to 64 bit integer type on windows.
body_text:
@alykhantejani That should be fine because there aren't many implementations that have long long be more than 64 bits. AFAIK this is true for all of the platforms that pytorch supports.
Besides the bigger change is going from long to int64_t as this changes a 32 bit integer type to 64 bit integer type on windows.
body:
@alykhantejani That should be fine because there aren't many implementations that have `long long` be more than 64 bits. AFAIK this is true for all of the platforms that pytorch supports.

Besides the bigger change is going from `long` to `int64_t` as this changes a 32 bit integer type to 64 bit integer type on windows.
